author: lgo
msg: On the multiple_ssl_impls branch:
* buckets/ssl_buckets.c:
Remove struct ssl_context_t as it was moved to the openssl_bucket.

author: lgo
msg: On the multiple_ssl_impls branch: move the bucket code implementing ssl
encryption & decryption with OpenSSL to its own bucket. Make an abstract
ssl_bucket which is currently just a wrapper for the new openssl_bucket.
* buckets/ssl_buckets.c:
Remove all code of the encryption and decryption buckets.
Keep the API, currently implement each function as wrapper for the new
openssl_buckets.
* buckets/bucket_private.h:
Define provide interfaces for openssl_buckets mimicking the ssl_buckets API.
(rename serf_ssl_ to serf__openssl for each function).
* buckets/openssl_buckets.c:
New bucket types OPENSSLENCRYPT and OPENSSLDECRYPT. Implements the bucket
and the ssl API (moved code from ssl_buckets to here).

author: lgo
msg: On the multiple_ssl_impls branch:
* README.branch: documents purpose for this branch.

author: lgo
msg: * branches/multiple_ssl_impls: new branch to test some ideas.

author: lgo
msg: Follow up to r1728: keep the benefits of the fix, but make it not break serf
over https.
* buckets/buckets.c
(serf_bstrcatv): fix target buffer size calculation. Don't count \0 char,
it's neither added nor needed.
* buckets/ssl_buckets.c
(ssl_encrypt): Fix incorrect buffer usage. After reading from the request
bucket (implement as aggregate bucket), we can't stash that data in case of
error, as the buffer will be freed on next read. So keep a copy we already
needed to make.
